intro: Antenoron neofiliforme, commonly known as the slender antenoron, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
